laboratory_examinations.findings: Severely atypical, recurrent, multifocal, epithelioid-cell melanocytic proliferation, with features consistent with melanoma. Maximum thickness of original tumor on reexcision was 5 mm. Two of three sentinel lymph nodes were positive for metastatic disease.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The original lesion was diagnosed as a compound type, traumatized Spitz nevus and later diagnosed as malignant melanoma after recurrence.
